.. note:: This model uses as much as possible the data model of Inspire with some adaptation, indicated in the notes.
description: JSON data model for the books, proceedings, standards, theses and reports in CDS.
title: A record in the books, proceedings, standards, theses and reports.

funding_info.description:
:MARC: ``536``
Information about the sources of funding for the research performed
in this record.
funding_info.title: Funding information

thesis_info.description:
:MARC: ``502``
Information on a thesis (degree, date, university)

defense_date.description:
:MARC: ``500__a``
Date of the thesis defense. On legacy, this was put in the
note field as 'presented on ...'.

institutions.description:
:MARC: ``502__c``
List of institutions issuing the degree.

_collections... note:: Different values compared to Inspire. Not mandatory, used for some specific subsets of the collection.
_collections.title: Collections to which this record belongs

public_notes.description:
:MARC: ``500``
Any notes about the document that do not fit into another field.
For arXiv eprints, also contains the contents of the comment field
on arXiv.
.. note::
    These notes are publicly visible. For notes not shown to
    regular users, see :ref:`_private_notes`.
public_notes.title: List of public notes

authors.description:
:MARC: ``100``, ``700``
Besides authors, also contains editors and supervisors (see
:ref:`hep.json#/properties/authors/items/properties/inspire_roles`).
authors.title: Authors

uuid.description:
Used by the BEARD author disambiguation tool. This
field should not be edited manually.
uuid.title: UUID

items.description:
``supervisor``
    :MARC: ``701`` is used for supervisor metadata.
    This person is a thesis supervisor. Should be
    used together with the ``thesis``
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.
``editor``
    :MARC: ``100/700__e:ed.``
    This person is an editor of the conference
    proceedings. Should be used together with the
    ``proceedings``
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.

value.description:
:MARC: ``100/700__u``
Currently, the old
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/legacy_ICN`
is used here. In the future, this will
change and become the new
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/ICN`.
value.title: ICN of affiliation

items.description:
:MARC: not present.
Role of the author according to the `Contributor
Roles Taxonomy (CRediT)
<http://dictionary.casrai.org/Contributor_Roles>`_
items.title: CRedit role of author

raw_affiliations.description:
:MARC: ``100/700__v``
List of full affiliations, as written on the paper.

full_name.description:
:MARC: ``100/700/__a``
Author name in Latin alphabet (may contain diacritics).
Should be of the form 'family names, first names', and,
except for a possible reordering, be exactly as on the
paper.
:example: ``Smith Davis, John F.K.``
full_name.title: Author name

signature_block.description:
Phonetic representation of the name, needed for author
disambiguation. This field should not be edited
manually.

preprint_date.description:
:MARC: ``269__c``
.. note::
    This is only for preprints. For the publication date of
    published documents, see :ref:`imprints`.
preprint_date.title: Preprint release date

titles.description:
:MARC: ``245``
There can be several because the preprint title often differs from
the published version. The title should be kept as on the document
and in the same language as the document (see :ref:`languages`).
Translations go into :ref:`title_translations`.
titles.title: List of titles

value.description:
:MARC: ``035__a``
Identifies the record in the external system specified
by :ref:`schema`.
:example: ``1999IJTP...38.1113M``
value.title: External identifier

schema.description:
:MARC: ``035__9``
Identifies the external system, and allows to interpret
unambiguously the :ref:`value`.
:example: ``ADS``

external_system_identifiers.description:
:MARC: ``035``
List of identifiers of this document on external systems.

keywords.description:
:MARC: ```6531`` and ``695`` (corresponding to different
    :ref:`keywords/items/properties/schema`)
Keywords give information about the specific contents of the
record, much more precisely than :ref:`inspire_categories`.
keywords.title: List of keywords

value.description:
:MARC: ``084/6531/695__a`` (depending on :ref:`schema`)
It belongs to the vocabulary specified by :ref:`schema`.
:example: ``black hole: mass`` (for :ref:`schema` =
    ``INSPIRE``)
:example: ``29.27.Fh`` (for :ref:`schema` = ``PACS``)
:example: ``G033M`` (for :ref:`schema` = ``PDG``)
value.title: A keyword

schema.description:
Describes to which vocabulary the keyword in :ref:`value`
belongs.
``INIS``
    :MARC: ``695__2:INIS``
    The keyword is part of the `International
    Nuclear Information System (INIS)
    <https://www.iaea.org/inis/>`_ vocabulary.
``INSPIRE``
    :MARC: ``695__2:INSPIRE``
    The keyword has been assigned by Inspire, and
    belongs to its vocabulary.
``JACOW``
    :MARC: ``6531_2:JACOW``
    The keyword is part of the `Joint Accelerator
    Conference Website (JACoW) vocabulary
    <http://jacow.org/Tools/Keywords>`_.
``PACS``
    :MARC: ``084__2:PACS``
    The keyword is a number from the `Physics and
    Astronomy Classification Scheme (PACS)
    <https://publishing.aip.org/publishing/pacs/pacs-2010-regular-edition>`_.
``PDG``
    :MARC: ``084__2:PDG``
    The keyword is a `PDG Indentifier
    <http://pdg.lbl.gov/2016/pdgid/PDGIdentifiers.html>`_.
.. note::
    If not present, the keyword is a free-form keyword,
    not necessarily part of any vocabulary.
schema.title: Keyword vocabulary

pubinfo_freetext.description:
:MARC: ``773__x``
Unstructured text describing the publication
information.
.. note::
    This field is used when provided with unstructured
    publication information, e.g. from arXiv. If known,
    the other fields should be used instead.

journal_title.description:
:MARC: ``773__p``
Journal title abbreviated as in the corresponding entry
in the Journals collection.
:example: ``Phys.Rev.``

cnum.description:
:MARC: ``773__w``
When ``conference` paper` or ``proceedings`` is among
:ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`, contains the
CNUM of the corresponding conference.
cnum... note: In CDS, for Proceedings. C-Num should also be in Conference_info.

artid.description:
:MARC: ``773__c`` (when it contains an ID instead of
    starting page or page range).
For journals which issue IDs for articles instead of
(or in complement to) continuous numbers within a
volume.
.. note::
    On legacy, this was treated as a starting page.
artid.title: Article ID

parent_report_number.description:
:MARC: ``773__r``
Report number of the document of which this record is a
part. This applies e.g. for large reports containing
several chapters that have been split into individual
records.

parent_isbn.description:
:MARC: ``773__z``
ISBN of the book of which this document is a part.

hidden.description:
:MARC: If ``true``, this comes comes from ``7731`` instead
    of ``773``.
This is useful when:
- there are variants in the way this publication is cited,
- an error was present, has been fixed, but should be preserved
    in order to find the record.
hidden.title: Whether this `publication_info` should be hidden

title_translations.description:
:MARC: ``242``
Translations of the titles in a language that is not the language
of the document (see :ref:`languages`).
Usually, this is contains an English translation of the title of a
non-English paper, but sometimes a native language if the paper is
in English but the title has been translated.

items.description:
:MARC: ``110__a``
In case the document has not been signed by a real author, but
only mentions the name of an organization.
:example: ``CERN``
items.title: List of corporate authors

copyright.title: List of copyrights to documents in this record

statement.description:
:MARC: ``542__f``
See `Wikipedia
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright_notice>`_ for
explanations.
Alernatively to this string, a URL to the copyright
notice may be provided in :ref:`url`.
:example: ``© The Author(s) 2015. Published by Oxford
    University Press on behalf of the Physical Society
    of Japan.``
statement.title: Copyright notice

languages.title: List of languages of the document

table_of_content.description:
:MARC: ``505``
List of chapters
.. note::
    Does not exist in Inspire

items.description:
Contains metadata of an arXiv eprint contained in this record.
.. note::
    This metadata is copied over from arXiv and should not be
    edited manually.
items.title: arXiv metadata

categories.description:
:MARC: first category in ``037__c`` with ``9:arXiv``,
    all categories in ``65017a`` with ``2:arXiv``
The first category in the list has a special meaning:
it is the primary category of the eprint on arXiv.
categories.title: arXiv categories of the eprint

additional_subject_categories.title: List of other subject (Project specific... ex. EUCARD)

subject_classification... note: Subject classification of the document, following standards ; does not exist in Inspire

medium.title: Physical medium to which this ISBN refers

description.description:
:MARC: ``020__u``
:anything in ``020__u`` that does not fit in medium and is not a volume.
description.title: Free text, used to describe the document to ISBN refers to.

items.description:
.. note::
    If the book series has a Journal record,
    `hep.json#/properties/publication_info` should be used
    instead.

volume.title: Volume of the book in the series

book_series.description:
:MARC: ``490``
List of book series in which this record has been published.
.. note::
    This field should only be present if ``book``, ``thesis`` or
    ``proceedings`` are among
    :ref:`hep.json#/properties/document_type`.

dois.title: List of DOIs
dois... note: This element can be found at the holding level or at the bibliographic record level.

document_type.description:
:MARC: ``980__a`` ``690C_a`` ``960__a``
Types of document this record represents.
.. note::
    As a record aggregates information from multiple sources, it
    can have multiple document types simultaneously. (?)
``book``
    Published Monograph (usually has an ISBN and a publisher)
``proceedings``
    Proceedings of a conference.
    The :ref:`conference_info` field contains the information of the conference.
    If published in a journal, :ref:`publication_info` also contains the journal information.
``report``
    A report. It can be unpublished, but can also be a book or a proceedings. In this case, it keeps the document type Book and Report or Proceedings and Report
``thesis``
    A thesis. The :ref:`thesis_info` field contains additional
    information about the thesis. If published as a book, the
    :ref:`editions`, :ref:`imprints`, :ref:`isbns` and
    :ref:`book_series` fields may contain specific metadata about
    this book and the document type can also be Book.
``standard``
    A standard.

acquisition_source... note:: To be checked with CDS team

report_numbers.description:
:MARC: ``037`` ``021`` ``088``
:example: ``DESY-17-036``
.. note:: Used for Standards numbers as well, with the source: standard.
report_numbers.title: List of report numbers assigned to the record

hidden.description:
:MARC: if ``true``, the :ref:`value` is in ``037__z``
    instead of ``037__a``.
Whether this report number should be hidden from the
display. This is appropriate for
* a report number that appears on the document but is
  not the one officially assigned;
* a report number that has been assigned by one of the
  authors institutions, but is not displayed on the
  document (typically for large collaborations).

curated.description:
:MARC: `500__a` containing `*Temporary entry*`, `*Temporary
    record*` or `*Brief entry*` correspond to `false`, otherwise it
    is `true`.
Whether this record has been curated by a human, to ensure the
quality standards of Inspire. Records having the :ref:`core` flag
are all curated eventually, whereas non-core records are
not systematically curated.

url.description:
:MARC: ``540__u``
URL where the full license statement may be found, if
only a short name is provided in ``license``.
url.title: URL of the license

license.description:
:MARC: ``540__a``
Either the short name of the license or the full
license statement.
:example: ``CC-BY-4.0``
license.title: License statement

record_affiliations.description:
:MARC: ``901``
Because of technical limitations, for some older records the
affiliations were associated globally to the record instead of its
individual authors (using the
:ref:`authors/items/properties/affiliations` field).
.. note::
    This field is present for legacy records and should not be used
    for new records.
record_affiliations.title: Affiliations not associated to authors

value.description:
:MARC: ``902__a``
Currently, the old
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/legacy_ICN`
is used here. In the future, this will
change and become the new
:ref:`institutions.json#/properties/ICN`.
value.title: ICN of affiliation

value.description:
:MARC: ``710__g``
Collaboration name as it appears on the paper (with the
``Collaboration`` suffix dropped).
:example: ``ATLAS`` instead of ``ATLAS Collaboration``
:example: ``Particle Data Group``
value.title: Collaboration name

_private_notes.description:
:MARC: ``595``
These notes are only visible to privileged users, not regular
users.
_private_notes.title: List of private notes

urls.description:
:MARC: ``8564``
URLs to external resources related to this record.
.. note::
    Links to internal CDS resources are found in another element.

accelerator_experiments.description:
:MARC: ``693``
.. note:: In Inspire, there is a link to the record of the experiment, do we want the same in CDS?
accelerator_experiments.title: List of related accelerators/experiments

experiment.description:
:MARC: not present.
If present, :ref:`institution` should contain the
institution where this experiment is located and
:ref:`accelerator` may contain the accelerator that this
experiment is using (if appropriate).
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.

accelerator.description:
:MARC: ``693__a``
If present, :ref:`institution` should contain the
institution where this accelerator is located.
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.

legacy_name.description:
:MARC: ``693__e``
This field is used when migrating from legacy instead
of separate :ref:`institution`, :ref:`accelerator` and
:ref:`experiment`. In the future, it will be deprecated and
the other fields will be used instead.
:example: ``CERN-LHC-CMS``
legacy_name.title: Identifier of the experiment on legacy

institution.description:
:MARC: not present.
.. note::
    Currently not used, see :ref:`legacy_name`.
institution.title: Institution hosting the experiment

abstracts.description:
:MARC: ``520``
The first abstract is the preferred one, to be displayed in
priority.
abstracts.title: List of abstracts

items.description:
:MARC: ``260``
When/where/by whom this record was published.
+ reprint information (does not exist in Inspire)
